attributes.magic: ELF 64-bit LSB executable, x86-64, version 1 (SYSV), statically linked, stripped

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the usage of utilities such as 'systemctl', 'service'...etc to stop or disable tools and services

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET MALWARE PeerBlight BitTorrent DHT CnC Checkin
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert udp $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET MALWARE PeerBlight BitTorrent DHT CnC Checkin"; content:"d1|3a|ad2|3a|id20|3a|LOLlolLOL"; depth:21; threshold: type both, count 1, seconds 300, track by_src; reference:url,www.huntress.com/blog/peerblight-linux-backdoor-exploits-react2shell; classtype:trojan-activity; sid:2066251; rev:1; metadata:affected_product Windows_XP_Vista_7_8_10_Server_32_64_Bit, affected_product Linux, affected_product Windows_11, attack_target Client_and_Server, tls_state plaintext, created_at 2025_12_10, deployment Perimeter, malware_family PeerBlight, performance_impact Low, confidence High, signature_severity Major, tag RAT, tag Description_Generated_By_Proofpoint_Nexus, updated_at 2025_12_10;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET DNS Query to a *.top domain - Likely Hostile
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert dns $HOME_NET any -> any any (msg:"ET DNS Query to a *.top domain - Likely Hostile"; threshold:type limit, track by_src, count 1, seconds 30; dns.query; content:".top"; nocase; endswith; reference:url,www.symantec.com/connect/blogs/shady-tld-research-gdn-and-our-2016-wrap; reference:url,www.spamhaus.org/statistics/tlds/; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2023883; rev:4; metadata:affected_product Windows_XP_Vista_7_8_10_Server_32_64_Bit, attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2017_02_07, deployment Perimeter, confidence Medium, signature_severity Major, updated_at 2020_09_15;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert udp $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET P2P BitTorrent DHT ping request"; content:"d1|3a|ad2|3a|id20|3a|"; depth:12; nocase; threshold: type both, count 1, seconds 300, track by_src; reference:url,wiki.theory.org/BitTorrentDraftDHTProtocol; classtype:policy-violation; sid:2008581; rev:3; metadata:created_at 2010_07_30, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, tag Description_Generated_By_Proofpoint_Nexus, updated_at 2019_07_26;)

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Generic catcher for P2P capable linux ELFs
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @_lubiedo

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects PeerBlight Linux backdoor with systemd persistence artifacts and user-mode masquerading strings, linked to React2Shell exploitation
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: RussianPanda

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis: This ELF binary is a sophisticated Linux backdoor/C2 agent, likely part of a botnet (potentially Mozi or a similar variant). It exhibits several malicious behaviors: 1) Persistence: It manipulates systemd and Upstart configurations to install itself as 'systemd-agent.service' and moves its executable to '/bin/systemd-daemon'. 2) Masquerading: It renames its process to 'ksoftirq' or 'usoftirq' to blend in with legitimate kernel threads. 3) C2 Communication: It contains hardcoded infrastructure (IP 185.247.224.41) and supports remote commands including file download/upload, SHA256 verification, and reverse shell capabilities via pseudo-terminals (ptmx). 4) Botnet Features: The code includes logic for DHT (Distributed Hash Table) operations like 'find_node' and 'get_peers', common in peer-to-peer botnets. 5) Evasion: It uses hidden files (e.g., .gKQ961...) and redirects output to /dev/null to remain stealthy.
